meanings.definition: The process of forming a head or concentration of sensory organs in an organism.
meanings.sent1: During evolution, cephalizations helped organisms develop better ways to sense their surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The cephalizations in insects allow them to process information efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The party game involved blindfolding players to test their cephalizations in identifying objects.
meanings.sent4: In the world of technology, the central processing unit acts as the cephalizations of a computer.
meanings.sent5: The cephalizations of a starfish include its central nerve ring and radial nerves.

meanings.definition: The development of a head or head-like structure in an organism.
meanings.sent1: The cephalizations in vertebrates often include complex brain structures.
meanings.sent2: The cephalizations of a snake help it locate prey using its heat-sensing pits.
meanings.sent3: The costume party featured guests wearing elaborate cephalizations to mimic famous characters.
meanings.sent4: The cephalizations of a ship, like the bridge, guide its course through the sea.
meanings.sent5: The cephalizations of a robot determine its ability to process commands and interact with its environment.
